page.title: 01DESCRIPTION OF KENTS GREEN
page.content: DESCRIPTION OF AREA AROUND KENTS GREEN The land itself is largely given over to agricultural use, growing crops and grazing cattle and a few sheep. There are a few areas of woodland which contain mainly deciduous trees. The area is very rural in appearance with few houses. The land is gently rolling hills not rising to more than 100 feet. The roads through the block are country lanes usually only 1 car width. There are some small streams cutting through on their way to join the River Severn. People either work on the local farms or travel to the surrounding towns. There is no manufacturing Industry. The area is served by a local bus service, The Post Office and British Telecom. Schools are in the local village and towns. A car is almost essential to get around.
